info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 11:05PM EDT until April 8 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Muncie.
.Minor flooding has developed near Muncie along the White River due to recent heavy rain. The White River near Muncie is expected to fall below flood stage by Friday afternoon, but minor flooding will likely redevelop this weekend into early next week due to additional rounds of heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall of two to four inches is possible.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Muncie.
* WHEN...From this evening to late Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Riverview and McCulloch Parks, including park roads, begin to flood. Backyards of houses in Yorktown along Buck Creek begin to flood. Backyards of houses and outbuildings along White River in Muncie begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Thursday was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 8.1 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late Sunday morning to 10.1 feet early Monday morning. It will fall below flood stage again late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Friday afternoon by around 215 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING
